Math.Display

Class DisplayComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JLabel
            • Math.Display.DisplayComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants, Math.MathObject

    public class DisplayComponent
extends javax.swing.JLabel
implements Math.MathObject
    The component that is used to graph an equation.
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics pGraphics)
                    throws MathException,
                           NotDefinedException
        The function that controls the drawing of the graphics.

        If ISEQIMAG is true, then both x and y will be incremented.

        The (X, Y) coords will be:
        X: The 'real' value of the complex number yielded when X and Y are plugged into EQUATION.
        Y: The 'imaginary' value of the complex number yielded when X and Y are plugged into EQUATION. The (X, Y) coords will be:
        X: The x value (which is being incremented).
        Y: The resulting value when X is plugged into theEQUATION.

        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        pGraphics - The graphics input that will be used to draw. Assumed to be Graphics2D.
        Throws:
        MathException
        NotDefinedException
